##Chapter 4 exercises
###4.1
***
A.
```{r}
a <- c(6, 9, 7, 3, 6, 7, 9, 6, 3, 6, 6, 7, 1 ,9, 1)
length(a)
a[] == 6
a[] >= 6
a[] <= 6
a[] != 6
```
***
B.
```{r}
b <- a[4:length(a)]
bArray <- array(data = b, dim = c(2, 2, 3))
bArray
bArray[] <= (6/2+4)
bArray[] + 1 <= (6/2+4)
```
***
C.
```{r}
c <- diag(10)
c[] == 0
```
***
D.
```{r}
for(i in 1:3){
if (any(bArray[,,i] <= (6/2+4))) {if(all(bArray[,,i] <= (6/2+4))) cat("Matrix ", i)}}
```
***
E.
```{r}
any(diag(c) == 0)
```
###4.2
A.
```{r}
foo <-c(7, 1, 7, 10, 5, 9, 10, 3, 10, 8)
foo >= 5 | foo == 2
```
***
B.
```{r}
bar <- c(8, 8, 4, 4, 5, 1, 5, 6, 6, 8)
bar <= 6 & bar != 4
```
***
C.
```{r}
(foo>=5|foo==2) & (bar <= 6 & bar != 4)
```
***
D.
```{r}
baz = foo + bar
#i
baz >= 14 & baz != 15
#ii
(baz/foo) > 4 | (baz/foo) <= 2
```
***
E.
```{r}
foo >= 5 || foo == 2
bar <= 6 && bar != 4
(foo >= 5 | foo == 2) && (bar <= 6 & bar != 4)
baz >= 14 && baz != 15
(baz/foo) > 4 || (baz/foo) <= 2
```
